attributes.action: Grant healthstores a business rates dispensation
attributes.background: Independent healthstores play a vital role in supporting preventative health, saving the NHS millions of pounds annually.  As valuable assets who invest in the health of their local communities, healthstores deserve the same recognition and dispensation of £1000 currently awarded to Public Houses.

attributes.action: Stop motorway closures at night
attributes.background: I am asking for signatures to stop the closure of England's major roads at night. These closures are costing companies incredible amounts of fuel and drivers’ tachos, hours. As a night HGV driver I have to navigate a huge truck many miles off route facing the horror of bad or no detour signage.

attributes.action: Change law & sentences for child sex offenders and rapists.  children under 18
attributes.background: I have recently looked into many child rape cases, and found when an offender is convicted that they may get a life sentence, and serve only 10 to 15 years of the term and be illegible for parole before the sentence term ends. I would like to have this sentence changed.
attributes.additional_details: Life meaning life to any child sex offenders with no parole and a life meaning life sentence not to be walking the streets again.

attributes.action: Give my parents visa to attend my graduation ceremony and see my wee girl Nara
attributes.background: Please help me have my parents attend my graduation ceremony and meet their new born granddaughter Nara. My parents require a visa to enter the UK and their recent visa applications have been refused. There is no right of appeal, hence I have started this petition. I believe the refusal is unfair
attributes.additional_details:
Their visit visa applications have been refused for what I believe wrong reasons.
Both my parents are over 60 years old and have lived their entire lives in their hometown, yet this is what they have received in the refusal letter:
“Given this, I am not satisfied that you are settled or established, or that you have shown sufficiently strong social or economic ties to your country of residence...”
Really?! Then what would be considered as “settled” or having “strong social or economic ties”?!

attributes.action: Make the referral process for SPD easier and raise awareness of the condition
attributes.background: Sensory Processing Disorder affects many children, who are struggling to carry out everyday tasks, which affects their wellbeing and education, parents are living with an everyday battle, and without help and support this is an overwhelming task, which is detrimental to the health of the parents.
attributes.additional_details: Many of these parents spend years getting endless declined referrals, and having to be persistent in finding other professionals to help, during this time a small person is left suffering and a family is left struggling, education is being affected, and these children are seen as naughty and disruptive. If a parent was seen to be leaving a child suffering, Social Services would intervene, yet many parents are begging for help to stop their child suffering, and are being ignored.

attributes.action: All children aged 16 to 19 in further education should be entitled to EMA
attributes.background: I am a mother to 4 children. Not all my children are entitled to EMA because we earn too much. Why should our children be penalised by the Government when EMA is for the child and not the parent? It unfair for all children in further education.
attributes.additional_details: Without EMA children like mine don’t have the money to do what their peers do. I have also spoken to other parents who feel the same way as I do and feel that our children are being penalised by the government.

attributes.action: Campaign to shelter the homeless during any night reaching sub-zero temperatures
attributes.background:
There is currently no legal protection for the homeless during severe weather - the provision of shelter (SWEP) is not a statutory duty even when conditions are life threatening

Make it a legal obligation for local authorities to provide shelter to all rough sleepers during severe weather.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.homeless.org.uk/our-work/resources/guidance-on-severe-weather-emergency-protocol-swep-and-extended-weather-provision

attributes.action: Student Finance made available for part time Paramedic degree
attributes.background:
We need the decision made by Student Finance England to not recognise the part time Paramedic BSc degree course we are in overturned. 
The course is delivered in partnership between Outreach Medical Services (ORMS) & The Robert Gordon University in Aberdeen
attributes.additional_details:
we have had positive, supportive responses from many people and although they agree that there should be support for paramedics We have received this response from student finance England 
“I have had a look at the courses Outreach Rescue provide and they would not be considered designated courses in relation to The Education (Student Support) Regulations 2011
 Also, the 3rd party company (Outreach Rescue) are not a franchise of your university.”

Please help us get this decision overturned

attributes.action: Hold an independent inquiry Health Service settlements
attributes.background: It has been reported that Virgin Care were handed almost £2 million in an out of court settlement by Surrey’s Clinical Commissioning Groups, NHS England and Surrey County Council in 2017. This is a gross misuse of public money, but no-one has resigned or been held accountable.
attributes.additional_details: Lessons deserve to be learnt from such losses of public money.

attributes.action: Make The Disability Symbol For Parking/Toilets Inclusive Of Hidden Disability
attributes.background:
Does the government feel that only wheelchair users are classed as disabled when 93% diagnosed with a hidden dissability are blue badge holders?
We propose a change of the current disabled symbol to the universal symbol of a blue circle as an adjustment to reduce prejudice discrimination and stigma
attributes.additional_details:
Most blue badge holders without obvious physical impairment who have parked in wheelchair symbol spaces have experienced animosity and prejudice by members of the public who judge them to be fraudulently taking up the space of 'disabled people' 
As a representative of the charity Epilepsy Sucks UK and mother of a son diagnosed with a severe form of epilepsy and autism who is a blue badge holder I have experienced this myself. 
I urge all with hidden disabilities to sign and state your diagnosis.

attributes.action: Put an end to the breeding and hunting of ‘game’ birds.
attributes.background:
Breeding any animal solely for the purpose of killing it for fun is medieval. 

There are alternatives to keep the traditional British industry going such as target/clay pigeon shooting.

We want the government to make the breeding of and hunting for game illegal.

attributes.action: Ban supermarkets from selling helium canisters.
attributes.background: On the 25th of January I lost my dad suddenly to suicide by a helium gas canister. The canister was purchased from a supermarket making it easy to obtain and go through with, without any detection of what he was about to do.
attributes.additional_details:
Helium works so quickly, it doesn’t give you time to think about what you are doing because you lose consciousness within a minute.
If you think of the restrictions they have on paracetamol, it’s crazy there aren’t more on this even more dangerous substance.

attributes.action: Grant free prescriptions to Auto-Immune Hepatitis sufferers
attributes.background: Some chronic auto-immune conditions (such as type 1 diabetes) qualify for free NHS prescriptions. Other auto-immune conditions (such as auto-immune hepatitis), which equally require life-long prescription drugs, do not. This petition seeks to ensure equality for such conditions.

attributes.action: Make the A1 junction with the A46 at Newark in Nottinghamshire safe.
attributes.background:
The A1 at Newark is a very busy. 
There are regular fatal accidents on this section of the road. Specifically where the A1 meets the A46 and A17. Both slip roads on North and South are too short. The slip roads need to be longer or traffic lights putting on each roundabout either side.
attributes.additional_details: Our local MP has acknowledged this issue in the past but nothing seems to have been done as yet.

attributes.action: Provide bereavement benefits for unmarried partners of 10 years or more.
attributes.background: Shawn and I were together for 26 years. He died on 31st March. It is unfair that bereavement allowances and payments are only for married couples and civil partners.
attributes.additional_details: People who are in a relationship for many years share the same costs and have the same financial responsibilities as married or civilly partnered people. They may have joint bank accounts and mortgages. They need the same rights to assistance when they lose their life partner.

attributes.action: Make students in the uk pay council tax in the city that they study and live.
attributes.background:
Students in Brighton and hove, that number in the thousands use all the resources that the residents use yet pay 0% council tax, this is wrong on every level, 
The residents are forced to pay increases year on year because resources are overused and  Underfinanced, students Must contribute.

attributes.action: More investment for electrification after the statement about diesel trains.
attributes.background: Following the announcement by the government that there should be no purely diesel trains running after 2040 there should be a government plan with associated extra funding to electrify more of the rail network to help facilitate this goal.

attributes.action: New EU membership referendum asking leave or remain until 55% majority reached
attributes.background: Given there are controversies, divisions and near impasse after the narrow simple majority in 2016 EU referendum to leave, with more information available Parliament to restore pre 2016 status and legislate for new same referendum until a minimum 55% threshold is reached by either side
attributes.additional_details: The 1974 referendum to join EU had 67% majority but 2016 EU referendum to leave was decided by a narrow simple majority of 51.9% leaving bitterness and deep divisions as both sides accuse the other of misleading the public. A divided nation fears walking into an unknown future. With clearer information now on consequences of remain or leave the 2016 outcome be set aside and another referendum could unite people behind a decisive outcome until a minimum majority of 55% of those voting is reached.

attributes.action: Ban diet companies from promoting their products on social media
attributes.background:
Eating disorders are causing people all over the world to lose their lives. 

Diet companies promoting their products on social media are directly influencing young people to purchase harmful products such as ‘appetite suppressants’ - which will ultimately lead them to develop disordered eating.

attributes.action: Remove prescription fees for those with mental health issues.
attributes.background: From our experience, many people suffering with mental health issues need a number of prescriptions, which are expensive. In particular those with bipolar have difficulty managing their money - it’s part of the illness. Bipolar is life threatening - their prescription should be free.

attributes.action: Utilise Highways England to reconstruct our potholed minor roads.
attributes.background: I propose that we utilise the skills of Highways England to manage the reconstruction of our potholed and increasingly dangerous minor roads. Funding to be provided by reallocating some funds from the Strategic Road Network budget. We need to stop further deterioration of our roads and rebuild.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways England manages our Strategic Road Network that includes most motorways and significant ‘A’ roads. This covers only 2% of our total road network and yet accounts for a third of all travelled miles. However, £21.6 billion was spent on the SRN last year whilst only £1.8 billion was granted to the minor road network.

We need to temporarily redress this financial imbalance to rebuild our local roads to ensure that the ‘first and last mile’ of our journeys are improved to a safe standard.

attributes.action: Add Lichen sclerosus to the Medical Exemption list
attributes.background: To obtain a Medical Exemption Certificate and get free NHS prescriptions a condition needs to be on the current Medical Exemption list. I feel this list does not go far enough to help those suffering with long-term conditions such as Lichen Sclerosus. A revision could help thousands of people.

attributes.action: Make all marketing of processed meats aimed at children illegal
attributes.background: With evidence now showing processed meats to be a group one carcinogen; meaning they are known to cause cancer, we cannot stand by and allow companies to profit from these products by marketing them to our children at the cost of their health.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.thelancet.com/journals/lanonc/article/PIIS1470-2045(15)00444-1/abstract

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2018/06/24/superman-batman-wonder-woman-recruited-food-giant-bid-counteract/amp/

attributes.action: Make public, communal eating space a legal requirement in high density housing.
attributes.background: A study found that regularly eating meals alone is the biggest single factor for unhappiness, besides existing mental illness. When we only design commercial spaces for individualised food consumption and cooking spaces for the single person, we are designing unhappiness.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it should be a legal requirement for housing developments of any significant density, to provide large social eating spaces and communal kitchens, in which inhabitants can cook for one another, socialise and share food freely. This will avoid public health concerns such as social isolation.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/23/the-friend-effect-why-the-secret-of-health-and-happiness-is-surprisingly-simple
 
foodhallproject.org

attributes.action: Training for all teachers and doctors to identify autism in males and females
attributes.background: Austism presents differently in males and females that most girls get left undignosed and left flying under the radar, a failed generation and we need to change this. All doctors and teachers everywhere should have the training to recognise autism in both sexes.
attributes.additional_details: We need to stop letting these children/family struggle because no one really knows what we go through, especially if you are an autistic female who can mask her traits by observing and mimicking what other children do and giving eye contact when it comes to comunicating but this is very exausting to the autistic female, which results in meltdowns as soon as she gets home from holding herself together all day and being someone she's not, just because we are female we are thought not to have autism.

attributes.action: Minimum of 1 England cricket Test match to be on free-to-air TV per year
attributes.background: Cricket participation levels in the United Kingdom are decreasing every year across all age groups (http://bit.ly/2MmseSJ) and this can be linked to the move in 2005 to show all England internationals exclusively on Sky Sports. It's time Test cricket was protected by Ofcom.
attributes.additional_details:
The ECB have recently dedicated to showing 2 T20 England Internationals a year from 2020 (https://ind.pn/2LUb4iV). 

However, this is not enough. It is time that some England Test matches are added to Category A of the "Ofcom Code on Sports and Other Listed and Designated Events" (https://wiki.sh/zehw) with a focus placed on Australia matches during an Ashes series.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Angora rabbit fur products in the UK
attributes.background: Angora rabbit fur is often harvested from live rabbits. Their legs are stretched and pinned down while their fur is ripped out leaving them to scream helplessly in pain. Its an inhumane and cruel practice that we must make a stand against.
attributes.additional_details: Britain should make a stand against and the Angora fur trade to demonstrate cruelly harvested products are not tolerated. The unethical practice of removal of rabbit fur in China has recently been highlighted by People for the Unethical Treatment of Animals (PETA.) Their graphic evidence is featured on their website. The rabbits are kept in disgusting conditions and subjected to abuse that is beyond words.

attributes.action: Make 29th March a National Bank Holiday - Called Independence Day!
attributes.background: On the 29th March the UK will officially leave the European Union - This should be celebrated nationally with a bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: After many decades being controlled through multiple European Union institutions, being unable to control our own trading policy, immigration system, waters and laws. On the 23rd June 2016, the United Kingdom voted to become a self governing country again - This will finally start to happen on March 29th 2019 - And it should therefore be celebrated.

attributes.action: Investigate the health impact of mobile technology on children and young people
attributes.background:
We call on the Government to examine the health impact of mobile technology on children & young people in reference to:

Sexting & Internet safety
Depression & Anxiety
General health
Sleep disorders
Technology addiction
 
Then commission an independent report
& act on its recommendations
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Matthew M. Davis from University of Michigan Health System
https://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2015-08/uomh-sai080715.php 

Smartphone Rehab article from the Independent
https://www.independent.co.uk/news/health/teenage-technology-addiction-smartphone-rehab-seattle-clinic-children-aged-13-mobile-devices-a7684356.html

Sonia Livingstone OBE Professor of Social Psychology (former head of dept at LSE)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyjbDUP1o0g&vl=en

Martin Blank PHD, Columbia University
https://vimeo.com/71864167

Dr. Devra Davis, Epidemiologist & Author (The Lancet, The Journal of the American Medical Association & The New York Times)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8cJ6Il5fFg4

attributes.action: Provide annual Breast Screening and handheld mammogram machines at GP Surgeries.
attributes.background: For many years women have been offered Breast Screening every 3 years. It is a National Statistic that women have been diagnosed with Breast Cancer between Screenings and most are deemed as not 'at risk' i.e., they do not have family history. Cancer is indiscriminate and can occur between Screening.
attributes.additional_details: Recently several women who have this disease found a change in their breasts themselves, had they not, their lives would be at risk of a higher Stage of Cancer or die before their next scheduled Screening. 3 years is too long, it is the difference between life and death. Other Countries do mammograms annually logically Early Stage treatment must cost less than treatment if left. There are cheaper handheld mammogram machines which could be put in GP Surgeries so annual Screening can be supported.

attributes.action: Legalise the use of batons by private security staff
attributes.background: Make the use and possession of extendable batons legal for licensed security staff after completing a training course.

attributes.action: To grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis.
attributes.background: The Home Office need to act to grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis. He was treated with it in Holland and his seizures reduced from 150 to 1 seizure a month. Alfie should not have to break the law to access his medicine. He needs this medicine to live.
attributes.additional_details: Alfie is 1 of 9 of nine boys in the world who suffer from PCH19. Without this licence from the Home Office to use medicinal cannabis Alfie's seizures will return to over 150 a month each requiring hospitalisation. He will not have the quality of life he deserves. The only treatment he responds to in the UK causes psychosis, organ damage and early death. The family should not have to accept this. The licence should be granted, Alfie is a patient not a criminal. He needs access to his medicine.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for school toilets to have no soap, toilet paper, or locks
attributes.background: Currently I don’t believe it is illegal for schools to have insufficient hygiene standards in toilets. Many students avoid using toilets during school which can cause further health complications including kidney infections. This also encourages smoking, bullying, and vandalism.

attributes.action: The importance of Attachment, should be taught in antenatal classes.
attributes.background: John Bowlby started his research in the 1960's - importance of a primary bond to a main person. He discovered that this role was vital in for survival, not only through infancy but long into adulthood. I struggle to understand in the 2018, this information is still not taught in antenatal classes.
attributes.additional_details: Attachments styles forms the basis of all children's relationships. The bonds that are created in the child's early life, impact the way a child develops all the way through their life. A secure attachment can create a child who is self-confident, self-resilient and has the support network to overcome barriers. An insecure attachment can affect a child in the opposite way. A child may become insecure, limited self-regulation and may struggle to form and maintain relation/friendships.

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toys in children’s fast food meals.
attributes.background: Fast food restaurants produce billions of non essential plastic toys every year to give away in children’s meals. The toys which are packed in plastic bags are usually thrown away before the children even leave the restaurant.
attributes.additional_details:
Children seem to enjoy the toys more than the meals but fast food outlets could change this by offering more variety and healthier choices. They could perhaps create paper comics as an alternative to the toys and these could be recycled. 
There is too much waste in the world and too much plastic going to landfill and ending up in our oceans. Fast food outlets would make a massive difference if they cared more about the plastic waste that they produce.

attributes.action: Issue guidance to make employers aware of their duties to menopausal workers.
attributes.background: To recognise and address menopause within the workplace and ensure support measures are in place, also to be aware of the impacts that it may have upon an individual and their overall health and wellbeing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact upon an individual during the menopause can be quite disabling which can affect the biopsychosocial aspects of our lives.

If a female is not supported in the workplace they may lose their confidence, social skills, their finances and their job, the loss to an employer can be huge, this is in terms of how much experience, knowledge and skills an individual may have and are valuable assets to a company, which could be unnecessarily lost due to lack of care and support.

attributes.action: Scrap the charges for child arrangement applications
attributes.background:
Where a resident parent agitates or denies contact between non resident parents and their children, the process for an arrangement order demands the non resident parent pay costs of £215 after also having to pay for attempts at mediation.
The right to a family life should not be priced in this way.

attributes.action: Local councils  to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.background: The consumption of clean water is a basic human need and millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills or in oceans to be eaten by marine life then into the food chain and human beings. Ask Parliament to implement a legal duty for local councils to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence for the danger of the breakdown of plastic is overwhelming, 
both in terms of damage to the environment, the food chain and in human bodies. This is an unknown health hazard and any efforts to reduce the use of plastic will be beneficial.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-43388870 
http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/ 
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_pollution 
https://www.lifewithoutplastic.com 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-42264788 
http://www.sciencemag.org/tags/plastic-pollution 
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-018-03104-3 
https://plasticoceans.org/the-facts/ 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/jan/25/new-network-of-water-refill-points-aims-to-reduce-englands-plastic-waste

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for all foreign vehicles using roads in the UK.
attributes.background: Currently foreign registered vehicles pay no charges driving in the UK, unlike European countries where an equivalent tax is subsidised by toll road networks. This is unfair to UK motorists & operators. Instigating a familiar system (vignette) at point of UK entry, collection would be easy & cheap.
attributes.additional_details: Many foreign drivers avoid payment at tolls, such as Dartford Crossing (Kent), where lost revenue runs at £42,000,000  in cancelled penalty notices alone. Prosecutions for excess speed, failure to stop/report accidents etc. would improve as drivers/owners are held to account utilising data collected. UK Insurance customers would see a dividend as foreign registered vehicles in the UK seek registration, tax & insurance in accordance with UK legislation, improvinvg safety, and the environment.

attributes.action: Introduce a reassuring EM radiation limit for homes and schools (eg 1,000 µW/m2)
attributes.background:
There is no specific limit for mobile phone radiation in homes. We use the out-dated 1998 ICNIRP recommendation for incidental public exposure, which includes no risk management. 

Badly sited masts result in unnecessarily high levels which are never turned off and the health impact is unknown.
attributes.additional_details:
The World Health Organisation continues to rate this type of radiation as a Class 2b Carcinogen and many studies link it to childhood lukemia and other illnesses. Sufferers of electrosensitivity are also becoming increasingly common.

A phone network continues to work at 0.000002µW/m2 (source: powerwatch.org.uk). Before it stopped auditing it, over 10 years ago, the highest level Ofcom recorded inside a residence was 790µW/m2. Other countries have sensible limits without affecting reception.

attributes.action: To make it compulsory that new drivers take a speed awareness course
attributes.background: On 22nd May 2018 my brother-in-law tragically died after road traffic accident. Ryan was on life support for 3 days when the doctors told his parents there was nothing else they could do for Ryan, the damage to his brain was so severe. This all happened because of speeding and lack of knowledge.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government to make it compulsory that everyone after passing their practical driving test must take a speed awareness course before being allowed to drive legally on their own.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of support given to sexual assault and rape victims.
attributes.background: 85000 women and 12000 men are raped every year, that is 11 every hour. 13% of women who are raped attempt suicide and 94% experience post- traumatic stress disorder within two weeks of the incident. I believe that all victims should be provided with support to guide them to living with the trauma.
attributes.additional_details: Misconceptions about false reporting have direct, negative consequences and may contribute to why many victims do not report it. I believe people should be better educated about the issues and people need to know about what they can do to help. Rapes do not always occur between strangers in dark alleys, 85 to 90 percent of victims know their attacker; this only makes it harder for victims to move on from the incident.

attributes.action: Make Dementia/Alzheimer's care completely funded by the NHS
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition. 
Thank you.

attributes.action: If there is a vote on the final EU deal then there must be no option to stay in
attributes.background: If there is a referendum on the final deal with the EU then the options must be simply deal or no deal. There must be no option to stay a member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details: It was clearly stated in the pro EU booklet: 'This is your decision. The government will implement what you decide.'   The once in a generation decision on whether we want to be in the EU or not has already been made, we voted to leave and that must be respected either way whether or not we can get a good deal and there must be no option to stay a member in any vote on the final deal.

attributes.action: Officially publicise only one title of Ms. for married and unmarried women.
attributes.background: Women must reveal their marital status on their title. This makes an issue for widows and some women who were discriminated by their title. The UK government must stop offering Mrs. & Miss as options and remove titles of Mrs. & Miss on all documents that they are responsible for.
attributes.additional_details: The title Ms. began to be used as early as the 17th century, as a title which like Mister that did not originally indicate marital status. It fell into disuse until the 20th century. What is needed today is a more comprehensive term which does homage to the sex without expressing any views as to their domestic situation. Ask the government to remove Mrs. & Miss. from official documentation, recognise and publicise Ms. functions officially as the only title both for married and unmarried women.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of eggs from caged chickens
attributes.background: Keeping caged chickens is wrong as chickens are living animals and deserve to be treated fairly. As many trusted sources have confirmed, it is extremely bad for them - they can become overweight and ill and lead unhappy lives.
attributes.additional_details:
As Cambridge University has proven, keeping hens in cages results in a “higher incidence of metabolic disorders”, which means that the chickens are under severe risk of SDS (Sudden Death Syndrome). This disease costs the US alone 100 million dollars annually – surely you don't want to allow this to continue in the UK too?

Letting caged hens have their own space is critical, and if we don't act fast we will be condoning cruelty.

attributes.action: Increase Defence spending to at least 2.5% of GDP per year
attributes.background: If the U.K. wants to maintain its global influence, it must increase its defence budget, rather than continue to cut it.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on HS2. Give the public the vote like we had for Brexit.
attributes.background: HS2 is expected to cost £50+billion, not to mention the mess and impact it will make on our countryside, wildlife and nature. At present our NHS, emergency services, social services, affordable housing is in disarray. We were given a referendum on Brexit which will affect us all so why not HS2?
attributes.additional_details: Having undertaken a great deal of research into the pro's & con's of this project, attended HS2 facilitated meetings, researched the impact nationally that this will bring I can't help but feel that even though Royal assent has been given its not to late to allow the public to vote on whether this project should go ahead. This country already has a good railway system which with investment can be improved using existing lines. The HS2 project is a national issue so should be decided by us all.

attributes.action: Pledge 5% of the UK's annual GDP to halt climate change
attributes.background: By heavily investing in green technologies, research and infrastructure within the UK now, this government would assure the industrial sector for the UK would become the preeminent leader in all green technologies before the rest of the world inevitably takes similar measures.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45084144
